data.title: FBI Foils ISIS-Inspired Plot To Attack Michigan Over Halloween Weekend
data.description:
On Friday, the FBI successfully averted a potential terrorist attack planned for Halloween weekend in Michigan. The plot, inspired by ISIS, was uncovered through online chatrooms where suspects discussed executing a violent attack, according to FBI Director Kash Patel.

CNN reports that multiple individuals were arrested as the FBI, operating from its Detroit field office, executed search warrants and subpoenas for phones, computers and other materials.

“This morning the FBI thwarted a potential terrorist attack and arrested multiple subjects in Michigan who were allegedly plotting a violent attack over Halloween weekend,” Patel said.

Also Read: Trump-Backed World Liberty Financial Token Rallies 12%, Leaves Bitcoin, Ethereum Trailing In The Dust

How The FBI Prevented A Halloween Attack

The FBI’s intervention was prompted by the suspects’ activities, which included visiting a shooting range with AK-47s and practicing high-speed reloads. A reference to “pumpkin day,” believed to be a code for Halloween, was reportedly picked up during their discussions. This led the FBI to act swiftly to prevent any potential threat.

According to John Miller, CNN's chief law enforcement and intelligence analyst, the investigation began months ago and involved individuals communicating online, both domestically and internationally. An undercover FBI agent was introduced into the chatroom early in the discussions.

What Motivated This Group’s Violent Plot?

The suspects were allegedly motivated by ISIS and had been discussing various options for a potential attack in the U.S. The specifics of their plan, including the target and timing, were unclear, but their activities at the shooting range raised significant concerns.

As reported by CNN, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer expressed gratitude for the quick response by the FBI and Michigan State Police, stating, “I am grateful for the swift action of the FBI and MSP protecting Michiganders.”

The Growing Threat Of Online Radicalization

This case highlights the ongoing threat of online radicalization, where individuals are influenced by extremist ideologies through digital platforms. The FBI’s proactive measures demonstrate the importance of monitoring such communications to prevent potential attacks.

The Dearborn Police Department assured residents that there is no current threat to the community, emphasizing the effectiveness of the coordinated law enforcement response.

  • Ford Is Pausing The Production Of The Best-Selling EV Pickup In US: Here Is What The Company Said About The F-150 Lightning

Photo: Matt Ragen/Shutterstock

data.title: iRhythm Well-Positioned For 2026 After Upbeat Results And Raised Outlook
data.description:
iRhythm Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:IRTC) reported a third-quarter loss of 6 cents per share on Thursday, better than analysts’ expectation of a 31-cent loss.

The company reported sales of $192.88 million, a 30.7% year-over-year increase, beating the consensus of $184.74 million.

Third quarter 2025 record quarterly revenue driven by continued momentum in core long-term continuous monitoring business, sustained demand for Zio AT, progress within value-based care accounts, and contribution from international markets.

Gross profit was $137.1 million, up 35.1%, while gross margin was 71.1%, a 230-basis point improvement.

The increase in gross profit was primarily driven by higher demand for Zio services, resulting in greater volume. The increase in gross margin was mainly due to volume leverage and operational efficiencies, partially offset by higher blended cost per unit from a higher Zio AT product mix.

Also Read: Investor Short Report Flags Steep Downside Risk For iRhythm Technologies

Guidance:

iRhythm raised its fiscal 2025 sales guidance from $720 million-$730 million to $735 million-$740 million compared to the consensus of $726.42 million.

Adjusted EBITDA margin for the full year 2025 is expected to range from approximately 8.25% to 8.75% of revenues.

Analyst Uptake

William Blair writes, “The company continues to demonstrate that it is firing on all cylinders—and, most importantly, that growth is durable.”

“With more Epic Aura account integration to come alongside a healthy pipeline of innovative channel partners and the next-gen Zio MCT set to launch in 2026, we continue to like the setup heading into 2026,” analyst Brandon Vazquez added.

William Blair reiterates an Outperform rating.

BTIG analyst maintains an iRhythm Buy rating and raises the price forecast from $195 to $215.

Needham maintains a Buy rating on iRhythm Technologies and raises its price forecast from $193 to $244.

Price Action: IRTC stock is up 3.19% at $190 at the last check on Friday.

  • Toyota, Nissan May Import US-Made Cars To Japan To Woo Trump: Report

Photo: Shutterstock

data.title: A Look Into Old National Inc's Price Over Earnings
data.description:
Looking into the current session, Old National Inc. (NASDAQ:ONB) shares are trading at $20.07, after a 0.64% drop. Over the past month, the stock decreased by 8.86%, but over the past year, it actually increased by 6.96%. With questionable short-term performance like this, and great long-term performance, long-term shareholders might want to start looking into the company's price-to-earnings ratio.

Old National P/E Compared to Competitors

The P/E ratio measures the current share price to the company's EPS. It is used by long-term investors to analyze the company's current performance against it's past earnings, historical data and aggregate market data for the industry or the indices, such as S&P 500. A higher P/E indicates that investors expect the company to perform better in the future, and the stock is probably overvalued, but not necessarily. It also could indicate that investors are willing to pay a higher share price currently, because they expect the company to perform better in the upcoming quarters. This leads investors to also remain optimistic about rising dividends in the future.

Old National has a better P/E ratio of 11.88 than the aggregate P/E ratio of 11.76 of the Banks industry. Ideally, one might believe that Old National Inc. might perform better in the future than it's industry group, but it's probable that the stock is overvalued.

In summary, while the price-to-earnings ratio is a valuable tool for investors to evaluate a company's market performance, it should be used with caution. A low P/E ratio can be an indication of undervaluation, but it can also suggest weak growth prospects or financial instability. Moreover, the P/E ratio is just one of many metrics that investors should consider when making investment decisions, and it should be evaluated alongside other financial ratios, industry trends, and qualitative factors. By taking a comprehensive approach to analyzing a company's financial health, investors can make well-informed decisions that are more likely to lead to successful outcomes.

data.title: Is Rambus Inc Gaining or Losing Market Support?
data.description:
Rambus Inc's (NYSE:RMBS) short interest as a percent of float has fallen 3.52% since its last report. According to exchange reported data, there are now 4.42 million shares sold short, which is 5.48% of all regular shares that are available for trading. Based on its trading volume, it would take traders 2.21 days to cover their short positions on average.

Why Short Interest Matters

Short interest is the number of shares that have been sold short but have not yet been covered or closed out. Short selling is when a trader sells shares of a company they do not own, with the hope that the price will fall. Traders make money from short selling if the price of the stock falls and they lose if it rises.

Short interest is important to track because it can act as an indicator of market sentiment towards a particular stock. An increase in short interest can signal that investors have become more bearish, while a decrease in short interest can signal they have become more bullish.

Rambus Inc Short Interest Graph (3 Months)

As you can see from the chart above the percentage of shares that are sold short for Rambus Inc has declined since its last report. This does not mean that the stock is going to rise in the near-term but traders should be aware that less shares are being shorted.

Comparing Rambus Inc's Short Interest Against Its Peers

Peer comparison is a popular technique amongst analysts and investors for gauging how well a company is performing. A company's peer is another company that has similar characteristics to it, such as industry, size, age, and financial structure. You can find a company's peer group by reading its 10-K, proxy filing, or by doing your own similarity analysis.

According to Benzinga Pro, Rambus Inc's peer group average for short interest as a percentage of float is 5.12%, which means the company has more short interest than most of its peers.

Did you know that increasing short interest can actually be bullish for a stock? This post by Benzinga Money explains how you can profit from it.

This article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and was reviewed by an editor.

data.title: MSTR To $270 On S&P 500 Speculation — Is A Breakout To $350 Now In Play?
data.description:
Strategy Inc. (NASDAQ:MSTR) shares rose as much as 8% to $274.52 on Friday as investors cheered record earnings and growing speculation about the company's entry into the S&P 500 index.

Analysts Cite Strong Fundamentals And S&P Potential

The company reported operating income of $3.9 billion and net income of $2.9 billion in the third quarter, a dramatic turnaround from last year's losses.

For the first nine months of 2025, Strategy recorded $12 billion in operating income and $8.6 billion in net income, with earnings per share rising to $27.71 from a loss of $2.71 a year earlier.

CEO Phong Le said during the earnings call that the company is "actively laying the groundwork for credit securities in international jurisdictions," signaling expansion into global markets.

For the second consecutive quarter, Strategy has qualified for potential inclusion in the S&P 500 — a milestone that could trigger substantial institutional inflows.

Stock Rebounds From Multi-Month Support

MSTR Price Forecast (Source: TradingView)

The stock rebounded sharply after testing the ascending support line near $260, a level that has consistently held since late 2024.

This recovery came after a brief dip below the 0.236 Fibonacci retracement near $305, signaling oversold conditions that attracted new buying interest.

The move also reinforces the long-term ascending triangle pattern forming since early 2024, with bulls defending the lower boundary multiple times.

If momentum holds above $275–$280, analysts see the next resistance near $294, followed by $305, where both the 20-day EMA and Fibonacci pivot converge.

Saylor's Focus Shifts To Debt Reduction And Credit Expansion

Executive chairman Michael Saylor reaffirmed plans to eliminate all convertible debt by 2029 while expanding Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC)-backed credit instruments internationally.

He highlighted that Strategy's multiple to net asset value (mNAV) remains around 1.25, its weakest level since early 2024, suggesting the stock is undervalued relative to its holdings.

Saylor attributed this compression to a maturing bitcoin market, the success of BlackRock's (NASDAQ:IBIT), and the stabilizing influence of derivatives markets, but said he expects mNAV to improve as digital credit offerings grow.

Technical Setup Points To Recovery Path

MSTR's technical outlook remains cautiously optimistic. The stock trades below key EMAs which define its near-term ceiling.

A close above $318 could confirm a breakout toward $350, while failure to maintain $260 support risks a pullback to $230, the year's major accumulation base.

RSI has improved to 40.5 from oversold levels near 35, while the narrowing MACD histogram indicates waning selling pressure and early reversal signals.

  • Nasdaq Surges Over 1%; Apple Earnings Top Views

Image: Shutterstock
